How To Publish Your Website Onto The Internet For Free | Step-By-Step Guide

Having a website on the internet is one of the important steps to help your business grow and get more audience. This step-by-step guide is designed to walk you through the process of publishing your website on the internet via GitHub pages for free.

Table of Content

  • Introduction
  • Step 1: Create a GitHub account
  • Step 2: Create a Repository on GitHub
  • Step 3: Upload your files
  • Step 4: Publish your Website through GitHub pages
  • FAQS
  • Conclusion

Step 1: Create a GitHub account

Go to github.com. and enter your email address. Then click "Sign up for GitHub"

After that, it will take you to this page where you should put your email, password, and your username. Fill them out and click "Create Account", and continue with the verification process.

After you finish it must take you to a page that looks like this

Step 2: Create a Repository on GitHub

A Repository is a folder on GitHub where you can upload your files and folders. So we are going to create a repository to upload our website files inside

To create a repository on GitHub click on your Profile Picture > Your repositories Then click on the green button "New"

Now write your repository name. It is recommended to choose a name that describes what's inside the repository.

On the Public / Private repository selection you should select whether to make your repository public, so everyone will be able to access it, or make it private, which means that no one can access it except you and your team. But it comes with a fee.

Choosing a private repository is more secure. Revealing a repository to the public when it shouldn't be disclosed opens the door for any online user to retrieve the code, potentially leading to the unauthorized appropriation of intellectual property. Only repositories intended for global sharing should be made public.

For the other settings, you can keep them default for now and click Create repository

Notice: You can change your repository settings anytime later.

Step 3: Upload your files

File Structure

Before you upload your files. I wanna mention an important point on the HTML file structure so you don't get any technical problems later.

Your website files and folders must be inside a folder, you can name it anything you want. However, the popular used name is "root". inside this folder, you will put your website folder, and the most important is to put your homepage file and name it "index.html" there. So your file structure must look something like this:

Why should I name my homepage name "index.html"?

When you type in the search bar "yourdomain.com" the search engine will look for a file called "index.html" If he didn't find it then you will get a 404 error. So, in that case, you should type "yourdomain/your homepage filename" and it will take you to your home page. So to avoid that, change your homepage name to "index.html" and make sure that there is no uppercase letter in the name

Upload your files

To upload your website files to GitHub, go to your repository Profile Picture > Your Repositories and click on your repository name then click on uploading an existing file then drag and drop your files

Disclaimer

Make sure you don't drag the folder that contains your files. Only drag and drop the files inside of it:

After it finishes uploading click Commit changes

Now your files must be uploaded into your GitHub repository

Step 4: Publish your Website through GitHub pages

To Publish your website on the internet via GitHub pages go to your repository and click on Settings.

Then click on the Pages tab.

On GitHub Pages go to the Branch section click on the button None and select Main. Then hit Save.

Now wait a few minutes and refresh the page. You will see this message appear:

This means that your Website is now successfully Put into the internet and when you click on that link it will take you to your homepage.

if it didn't take you to your homepage. then it might be a problem with your file structure go back and read the File Structure section.

FAQS

Conclusion

You've successfully navigated the process of publishing your website on the internet for free using GitHub Pages. This step-by-step guide has equipped you with the knowledge to create a GitHub account, set up a repository, upload files with a proper file structure, and ultimately publish your website. By following these clear instructions, you've not only established your online presence but also opened doors for your business to reach a wider audience.
